title: BFramework
description: I taught myself Java by building a video game framework. Was it dumb? Probably. Did it work? Yep, it worked! I and a team built a game on top of this framework and took 2nd place internationally in TSA's "Video Game Design & Programming" event in 2017.

title: Backus-Naur Sentence Generator
description: Exploring natural language processing for a presentation, I made a grammar parser which can randomly generate sentences in various languages. I plan to use it to create a math problem generator.

title: Resume
description: View my programming resume online! I made it using pure HTML & CSS, a format that seemed quite fitting for a professional web developer.

title: Carbon Cycle Simulator
description: One day in Biology class, we were doing a complicated simulation of the carbon cycle; 'wow, I could automate that,' I thought. Working with the instructor, I then created this website!

title: Axis & Allies Dashboard
description: Have you ever been playing a nice game of "Axis & Allies"â„¢ yet cannot remember whose turn it is or lack sufficiently invigorating music? Worry no longer! This website cycles through the countries in proper order, showing their flags and playing their anthems (all as in WWII)!

title: FMBQ Jump Lights
description: Putting the "free" back into Free Methodist Bible Quizzing, this program effectively simulates a $150 set of jump seats and can be used with a simple combination of screen and standard QWERTY keyboard!

title: BV.game
description: A simple game made with a completely rebuilt version of BFramework, with teammates, for the TSA "Video Game Design/Programming" event in 2018.

title: Pranks
description: A collection of simple BASH commands with humorous effects, hosted online so that I can easily access and run them on other computers.

title: Binary Quiz (App Lab)
description: A simple quiz that asks you to categorize words into one of two similar categories! Simple, but addictive. Made with code.org's "App Lab".
